newsitem.title: USA: Cooper unit sale to Newell cleared by Justice.
newsitem.headline: Cooper unit sale to Newell cleared by Justice.

text.p: Newell Co and Cooper Industries Inc said Monday the U.S. Justice Department has cleared the sale of Cooper's Kirsch business to Newell.
The companies said they would close the deal as soon as other conditions are satisfied, likely in early June.
On January 30, the companies said they signed a letter of intent for the transaction. Terms were not disclosed.

Kirsch makes drapery hardware and custom window coverings. Cooper makes electrical products, tools and hardware and automotive products. Newell makes consumer housewares, hardware and tools, home furnishings and office products.
